column3:
My Father played the guitar, but he is having some health problems right now.
I'm sorry to hear that, hopefully he starts feeling better soon. How are you holding up?

I am doing ok. Thanks for asking. Playing guitar helps me cope. My father has a cool collection of guitars.
Nice, any particular songs you normally play?

I love to play Jimi Hendrix songs. Are you a fan of 1960's rock? What is your favorite genre?
Of course, I love 60's rock, my favorite has to be classic rock for sure. Zeppelin and The Doors have to be my favorite bands

I love the Doors! They have such a unique sound. Do you have a favorite Doors song?
It's a tie between People are strange and Love me two times. What's your favorite?

I think my favorite is Love Street. It has such a haunting melody. Have you heard that one?
Yeah, it's a pretty great song, Jim Morrison was just an amazing songwriter, I aspire to make songs as good as his one day.

I wish you the best of luck. Music is a great way to express yourself.
The best way in my opinion. There's just so much that can be said through music that sometimes can't be expressed in words alone.

column3:
"I've been thinking about them a lot, especially on my long drive to and from work. They make me crazy."
"how so?"

"They are hoarders. They hang on to everything. Going from the kitchen to the living room is like going through a junk yard!"
"do you live with them still? that sounds rough"

"My mom is disabled and my father is getting senile, so they live with me and my family. "
"that has to be rough. props to you for stepping up like that. "

"Thanks, as much as they drive me crazy, I don't want them to end up in a nursing home. It's just tough some days. What are your parents like?"
"Difficult. We don't see eye to eye on a lot, but they don't live with me so its easier"

"I understand. My dad and I don't agree about anything. Arguing is our favorite father/son activity lol"
"I try to put limits on it. Or make excuses to get off the phone."

"I wish I could still do that! Living together makes escape difficult. I usually go out to the barn and hang out with the horses to get a break."
"its nice that you have a place to go. i don't know how i'd get by with my mom in the same apartment. "

"It could just be a rodent or something. I'm a pest controller you would be surprised at some of my stories."

"I hadn't thought about that!  What's the scariest thing you've ever found on a job?"
"Giant rats are pretty scary to some people. I kind of hate my job though I want to quit and explore the world."

"I don't blame you.  What's your dream vacation?"
"I want to visit the great barrier reef. Have you heard of it?"

"I've heard of it but have never been.  You should go!"
"I think I just might. I hope you figure out whatever is under your bed."

column3:
"I manage a farm ,I like writing short children story's "
"That's interesting.  What do you enjoy about writing?  I enjoy art myself."
"I like to tell small story's about farm animals and the adventures that they have "
"I bet kids love your stories.  How did you get started in writing?"
"My mom use to make up story's about the baby calves we raised when I was little "
"That' s a really sweet memory.  My mom homeschooled us growing up so I have fond memories of her reading to me."
"that is cool , was it fun learning like that did you have a lot of home work ?"
"It was okay. I missed out on stuff that other kids get to do in school."
"I bet so , It would be different and not being around others did you have friends ?"
"Yeah.  There's an area club of sorts you can join.  I mostly met kids playing sports and taking art classes."
"that was good , plus you did out some around others,there some little boys close to home that is home school they go to different places and learn things "
"Do they ever come to your farm for field trips?"

'That is great, and yes you should I believe its easier to accomplish with goals'

'First thing on my bucket list is travel to Germany for Oktoberfest. What are some other things on your bucket list?'
'Great, next thing on my bucket list is to travel to Santorini Greece'

no school for me either.  classes were hard for me to stay awake through

I like to sew all sorts of things like pillows and blankets with stitches and a needle and thread. I try to sew items for homeless people as well.

column3:
ugh spiders. can we not talk about those
Sure!  I don't really like them either.  I hate it when I walk through a spider web.  I'm on the tall side so it happens often.

every time i see a web i freak and search the whole house the idea that ones hiding is just. UGH

haha i guess its something like that.

omg no way im not going any where near a bunch of spiders! that sounds like torture not therapy

idk if its a phobia, but i worry a lot about bad things happening to my family? but thats normal i think

column3:
['yes, my situation has improved, i have learned to enjoy being alone now and spend a lot of my time hiking.', 'Hiking is a wonderful hobby. Have you ever considered doing it in a group?']
['I have hiked in groups before but I think i prefer doing it by myself. It eliminates distractions and allows me to be fully submerged in nature. Do you hike?', 'not often, maybe i should more']
['I would recommend it. What do you do as a hobby?', 'i play badminton. im in a rec league but we take it pretty seriously']
['oh wow. that is neat. do you play singles or doubles?', 'i usually do singles, but sometimes we double up if there are a lot of people there']
['that is cool. how long have you been playing for?', 'a long time. i messed around with it as a kid but i got more serious in college']
['that sounds like a fun hobby to have.', 'it is, and good exercise too, a lot like hiking']
column4:

我儿子现在有16只小猫，他们需要一个新家。

哦，我知道人们对小动物可以很残忍，他们想在我们镇上建立一个猫收容所。

并为它们找到一个温馨的家，我可以为它们填满。

我住在农场，所以有很多空间让它们四处漫游。

我知道一件事，我没有老鼠。

"In New York City. He saw a man get mugged and drove his taxi into the entrance of an alleyway to block the thief's escape. He was ok though."

"wow, did they catch the guy?"
'They sure did. My father got an interview with a local news channel and my sister and I got to be there too.'

"That must be great footage to pull out at family gatherings."
'Yeah we were all very proud of him. We take him out to celebrate the event every year with dinner and a movie.'

"That's awesome. Sounds like a great family."

column3:
"No, but it was probably just a branch or something. It's getting windy."
"Bad weather inbound?"

"Yeah, it is supposed to get very cold and windy soon. Maybe some storms as well."
"It stays pretty warm where we are down south. Thank goodness too, I dont want my girlfriend trudging through the snow pregnant"

"Yeah I miss the warm weather of the South, I just recently moved to the West coast. That is great news! When are you guys expecting?"
"Well, shes about six months along now, so it shouldn't be too much longer, seems like its gonna be a January baby if all goes well"

"I wish you luck with that, must be a lot to deal with! Is it your first child?"
"Yes. But I think we will be okay, I am the only one who works so she can stay home and focus on the child."

"That is convenient. I hope she (and you) doesn't get too tired dealing with a new born all day and night!"
"Oh im sure we will be very tired. I hear that newborns don't like to sleep peacefully, so neither will we."

"That's rough! But you will have a great experience raising a child, and it will definitely take some team work!"
"Thanks! Yeah I will try to help out as much as I can when I am not working."

column5:
恶劣天气即将来临吗？

我们在南方的地方还是挺暖和的。谢天谢地，我不想让我女朋友怀孕的时候在雪地里跋涉。

嗯，她现在怀孕大约六个月了，所以应该不会太久了，如果一切顺利的话，看起来会是一个一月份的宝宝。

是的。但我觉得我们会没问题的，我是唯一一个工作的人，所以她可以呆在家里专心照顾孩子。

哦，我肯定我们会非常累。我听说新生儿不喜欢安静地睡觉，所以我们也不会。

谢谢！是的，我会尽量在不工作的时候帮忙。
column6:
或许是一只小动物在树上或灌木丛中移动，也有可能是树叶被风吹动所发出的声音。风越大，声音也会越响亮。不过，最好还是小心谨慎，确保自己的安全。

建议大家注意保暖，并做好防风防雨的准备，避免在恶劣的天气条件下外出。同时，也要注意室内取暖安全，避免发生火灾等意外。希望大家都能平安度过这段寒冷的天气。

"我理解，南方的天气确实比较温暖。我们的预产期是明年春季，所以还有一段时间呢。你呢？有没有在西海岸找到喜欢的地方？"

谢谢！是的，这是我的第一个孩子。我很兴奋和期待，也知道会有很多事情要处理。感谢你的祝福！祝你也好运！

谢谢你的关心！我会尽力帮助她照顾好我们的宝宝，让她不至于太累。我们会一起努力，共同照顾好我们的家庭。感谢你的祝福！

是的，养育孩子是一项艰巨的任务，但也是一种非常有意义和值得的经历。团队合作确实非常重要，无论是与配偶、家人、朋友还是其他支持系统一起共同努力，都能让养育孩子的过程更加顺利和愉

How exactly do you do that?
I help my clients by providing detailed sports information to help their choice on who to bet on.

Oh, I see. So you must be good at remembering stats of players and teams.
It is good to remember the good teams, but nothing beats doing research online.

Which sports do you focus on?
I try to focus on football, but I also do baseball, bowling, and horse races.

Cool. I follow college football but don't gamble. It seems every time I do my team loses.
That seems to happen a lot, with voting on your favorite team without looking at stats.

Do you rely solely on your research or does instinct come into play? What if you're making a recommendation to a client and your favorite team is involved?
I tend to follow research more, but sometimes you can get that gut feeling about a team.

Do you know how much a client is betting when you're making your recommendation?
Some times they tell me, and sometimes they do not. I tend to not want to know that information because that makes you feel more connected if they lose it.

I can imagine. I'd probably not want to know--especially if they lost!
Yes it would make you feel very bad, and question yourself.

"That is awful.  I hope everyone is okay.  Do you know anything more?"
"Not really. No details have really been released but they don't suspect that drinking was involved."
"I just hate to hear that about anyone.  Even worse had alcohol been involved.  I don't drink myself."
"Yea I try to on social occasions. You know how college is, sometimes you have to tie one off just to get through the classes"
"Yea; I can understand.  College is actually where the stress led me to eat and live much healthier."
"She was just in her fall semester classes for her Bachelor's. Such a waste.  I hear that they left a party in another city"
"I hate to keep asking questions if you don't know, but did they total the car?  Do you know what happened to the other car?"
"Well I spoke to her dad. The car was totaled. No word on the other driver. It wasn't local to our county so not on our news."
"Well, how are you doing?  I know this has to be tough on you - an emotional time for you."
"Very much so. We've know eachother since 4th grade. I don't think the reality has set in yet "
"I really hope family and friends will rally around to help.  I can't even imagine how difficult this is for you."

"I'm from Texas. How about you?"
"i'm from mississippi . just moved back here from austin texas"

"Ahh! You must of seen moped's around Austin. I would imagine it would be an easy way to get around for college kids."
"I remember seeing some on the street that just looked like motorized bikes."

"My oldest son is in College and he wants an electric scooter to get to classes on the other side of campus. What made you leave Austin?"
"the shed . we had some leaks , and broken trees . half the town got torn apart ."

"Oh wow! I am sorry to hear that. How is Mississippi treating you?"
"Pretty good so far. How about you?"

"I have only driven through Mississippi. Texas is typical bipolar weather Texas. It's in the 40's and raining. I was wearing shorts 3 days ago though"
"I always wear shorts everywhere."

column3:
"I've got 3 sisters.  Adore them!"
"Sounds exciting.  I've heard girls fight over the bathroom time, with make up, hair, and all.  Was that an issue at your house?"

"It was a huge issue!  My oldest sister was the bathroom hog - she was always sitting on top of the sink and listening to the Beatles!"
"Did any of your sisters, or you, take dance lessons?  I'm studying to be a ballet dancer."

"Ballet is such a beautiful form of dance.  I took ballet, tap and jazz.  I did best with jazz. "
"That's great!  Jazz?  Is that like tap dancing?  "

"I think it went from jazz to modern dance by label.  I performed to Flashdance in my first show to give some context."
"OMG what a great movie!  So many good dance routines and songs.  Wish movies were like that now.  Now it's all blood and gore."

"Me either especially considering my pay for selling washers there ! lol"

'I like to unwind with music and a good book. You?'
'Pretty much the same for me, on the weekends I enjoy riding my bike through nature.'
'That sounds like a good way to have fun and get some exercise especially when the weather is nice out!'
'Definitely, helps me clear my mind after a long week in the insurance business. What kind of music do you listen to to relax?'
'All kinds! I love trying out new bands. '
"Same here, music is a huge passion of mine. I'm willing to give anything a shot at least once."
"Nice. so do you see yourself selling insurance long term? What's your dream job?"

column3:
"I freelance, so it varies quite a bit. On a good year I'm on the six figure fringe."
"Wow, that's awesome. For my job, I help build cars. I love my job, but it only makes 30k per year."

"Nothing wrong with that, the most important thing is whether or not it's something you're passionate about and enjoy doing."
"That's true, for sure. I have met many people who made a lot that did not seem happy or who did not enjoy their jobs."

"Yeah, freelancing suits me pretty well. I have a hard time sitting still so being able to bounce around and do whatever feels right is nice."
"I rather like having a predictable schedule but it is certainly not for everyone. What is your side gig?"

"I like finding old cars and restoring them and then selling them. Although sometimes I fall in love with the old junky ones and end up keeping them myself"
"That sounds similar to what my friend does flipping houses. He loves his job and it sounds like you do too!"

"Yeah, it's pretty rewarding and I really enjoy it. Have you ever considered a side gig?"
"I actually have a side gig where I go to various places taking pictures for a company and answer questions and they pay me. It's fun."

"Wow, that sounds awesome. How long have you been doing that?"
"For almost two years now. It definitely helps me supplement my income and raise a family, and it's become a nice hobby in itself."

column3:
Is it a good investment long term?
I really haven't thought of it as an investment.  It's more about a good place to raise my kids.

The kids could learn so much living on a farm.
I know I did.  And we had a lot of fun, too.

How many generations has the farm been in your family?
I'm the third.  My grandparents bought the place, then my dad took over, now it's up to me.

I think you'll do great! It's a wise decision to keep the farm.
Just talking about it reminds me of all the good times we had, like swimming in the pond, doing hayrides, so much fun.

I wish I could have grown up on a farm.
Well, it's a lot of work, too.  Between the animals, baling hay, the garden.  But there were probably good times where you lived, too, right?

Yes, I enjoyed riding my bike around the neighborhood with the other kids.
Did you have a lot of friends in the neighborhood?

Yes, all the kids hung out together.
That would be nice.  I used to stay over with my friends in town some time, go to the movies or whatever.

column3:
"Haha, that's definitely one way of putting it. As a classically trained chef, I really enjoy working with shrimp."
"Since I cut out meat, I really miss shrimp."

"Cut out meat? Did you do it for health or ethical reasons?"
"A little bit of both.  I really needed to cut down on red meat especially, and I was reading about all the water it takes to raise meat."

"I've heard that as well. I try not to think about it, I have male pattern baldness and the stress of things I have little control over don't help!"
"Male pattern baldness?  What's that?"

"It's basically the way a male loses hair, you start losing hair at the hairline and it keeps going up from there."
"I've noticed my hair is getting thinner lately.  Never used to be a problem.  Comes with age, I guess."

"Yup, no sense in worrying about it. Eventually i just plan on shaving it all off, at some point it's more trouble than it's worth."
"That's not fair!  Women can't do that.  I'd have to buy a wig."

"That's okay, I hear the quality of wigs are great these days. Getting ready in the mornings would be pretty quick too."
"LOL!  So, are you going to the concert this weekend?"

"Always more money lol. If you wanted to travel, could a trusted person look after the cats?"
"Possibly.  I might be able to get someone to come stay with them, take care of the cats and the yard."

"My mother does that for me, she also looks after my grandmother.  I'll miss them."
"How soon are you leaving?"

"Next month, so time to get all my ducks in order lol"
"Lots of time.  How is your grandmother doing?  Does she still watch The Voice every week?"

"She wouldn't give that up! But she'll miss watching the hockey with me, i love hockey, so does she"
"Aw, that's too bad. But there'll be other games."

"Good old Heinz, so regular. What's mushroom ketchup?"
"It's fermented napa cabbage, a Korean dish."
"Hmm, what's it taste like?"
"It is not the most pleasant dish, let me just put it that way haha"
'Haha okay, so are you gonna make meatloaf soon?'
"I probably will. People make meatloaf with beef, pork, lamb, or even veal! So there's a lot of approaches."
'I have only ever made it with beef. What way do you like best?'
'I like to be unconventional and use lamb, pork, or veal instead of ground beef.'
'Interesting, maybe the kids would be interested to try that sometime, do you have a recipe?'
'My grandmother had a great recipe. I think of her every time I have it now.'
"That's so sweet, I always think of my dad when I make mac and cheese from scratch"
"That's nice, I love mac and cheese"

Yes, protein is very important for your health, and for building lean body mass.

Fried food is not good for you. Grilling is a good way to go when cooking meat. Beans and yogurt are also a good source of protein.

"Thanks, it was a pleasure talking with you."

"Is your son planning to play football in college?"

"Yes, he hopes! He is 6'5" and has a nice spin on his pass!"
"Best of luck to him, maybe he'll end up playing for a great school like Alabama! Roll tide!"

"He would love that! Believe me...his Super Heroes are Rodgers and Brady, and right now he's just a Sophomore but playing Varsity...so who knows!"
"Varsity as a sophomore is fantastic! Did you used to play any sports yourself?"

"No, I was more of an art person, That's why I collect seashells, I make custom lampshades for clients."
"Wow those sound neat! Do you live near a beach?"

"Yes, I'm a big fan of lizards so I own a few of those. What kind of dog do you own?"

"I have a German Shepherd, he's still a puppy. I got him for my girlfriend a few months ago, but she tells me she doesn't want him anymore."
"That's too bad, I've always loved german shepherds, they're very smart."

"He's already so smart! She tells me she's leaving me. I'd choose my dog and guitar over her any day!"
"Haha, I hear that. I'm big into my guitar as well, I've always been the guy with long hair and a rebellious rock attitude."

"I find I need my family more now that I'm out of school."
"do you have a large or small family?"
2 brothers, 3 sisters
"Cool, siblings can be like really good friends if they get along. I'd say me and my sister get along pretty well."
"I love them all. I'm the baby."
"It's awesome to have so many siblings, do they all live close to you?"
"They're all on the West Coast, which is horrible. I'm on the East."
"That can be very rough. Maybe you can move there soon!"
"It's too fake out there. And I have my own kids, now."
"that's unfortunate that they are so far, do you do family reunions yearly?"
"Every Christmas is a reunion at my folks' in New England. Do you see your family often?"
"I live very close to family, so I see them a lot."

Yeah. I'm an only child. So we're tight.

That's sad. Did you repair the relationship?

yes, we are working on it.
I have the same situation with an uncle of mine who abused my dog in front of me. I'm trying to forgive him.

I wouldn't forgive him for that. There's no excuse for that kind of behavior.
I agree. But he's family. You know? That means something.

is he even remorseful?
No. He's just an angry person and the rest of us have to accept that about him.

You don't have to accept that. That's not how family treats other members (including animals), I wouldn't consider him family.
I'm a Christian. It's what we do.

'Oh I understand now! Yeah, but they are better than the geese'
'they can be a turn off for running in the parks, and make me consider running on the treadmill, but love the action of outdoors.'

"I do too it just isn't the same on the treadmill. You cant replace the feeling of the cool crisp NY air"
"Yeah, running in outdoors is more satisfying to me. So colorful. Fuels an artist's imagination."

'Ahh so you are an artist! WHat is your preferred method of crafting?'
'a teacher, but I dabble on my own time, of course, on the canvas.'

"That's wonderful! What do you prefer to paint?"
'florals, and stills, currently. Yourself?'

'I like to be alone so my girlfriend and I work different shifts. She is a waitress'
"It sure is! I love tacos myself so it's great for me!"
"For the most part. She works handling a lot of cash. Can't be all bad, right?"
'That would be nice, sounds lovely!  Does she enjoy it?'
'I say whatever brings home the bacon! '
'Not at all, I work in a "cash only" business myself!'
'As long as the bills are paid! '
"As long as I'm putting food on the table nobody is asking questions."
"Good taste in style and food, I hear you. I'm a social media content creator for a well known company. What do you do?"
"As long as I'm decked out in Louis V head to toe I am happy."

"Indeed, Elon Musk is a genius though, Hes made the Tesla Powerwall, Powerpack batteries, solar panels and solar roof tiles for people all over the world."

'Agree totally...and we need to be collectively and seriously exploring all options away from fossil fuel without a doubt.'
"What do you think about solar? I hope we can pave the planet with panels someday!"

'Solar is a great option, but also worry about the balance of nature vs technology. Its all about balance'
"I see, how do you think we can balance technology with our lives?"

'Envision this, "This used to be Yellowstone National Park, but now every living tree and plant has been removed to be a monstrous solar field"...ugh'
"I can see your point, it is definitely a balancing act!@"

"Life is an evolution, but I enjoy exploring the potential options that's for sure"
"Explore while you are still young.  Once you get married and have kids it's all over."

阅读的确是一个非常好的获取知识的方式。通过阅读，我们可以了解到各种各样的信息和观点，拓宽自己的视野，增加见识。同时，阅读也可以激发我们的思维，启发我们的创造力，帮助我们更好地理解世界和自

例如，一个老师可能会对某些学生有偏见，认为他们不够聪明或者不努力。这种偏见可能会导致老师在对待这些学生时表现出不公平或偏袒其他学生的行为。

另外，人们在交谈时也可能受到社会文化的影响，

这是非常重要的。确保我们基于客观的事实和证据形成观点，而不是基于主观偏见或误导性信息。这样才能保持清晰的头脑，做出明智的决策。信息的真实性和可靠性至关重要。

教育孩子并扭曲他们的世界观是不道德且有害的行为。父母和教育者应该尊重孩子的个性和独立思考能力，引导他们建立积极的世界观和价值观。教育应该是启发和鼓

作为父母，我们需要不断学习和适应，以满足孩子在不断变化的世界中的需求。我们需要关注他们的情感和心理健康，培养他们的自信和自尊，同时也要教导他们如何处理挫折和困难。这需要耐心、理

我们在很多方面都有不同的兴趣和个性特点，但正是这种不同让我们互补，让我们的关系更加丰富多彩。我们互相学习、互相成长，让彼此变得更好。虽然我们有时候会因为不同的看法而产生摩

'I suppose one could call it that.'
'Do you have relationships with your eyebrows?'

"I'm particularly fond of my chest hair, actually. It's name is William."

"I love music, I also like to fish. I usually fish walleye and crappie to stock freezer and bass fish for fun"

"Oh sick! I only fish for fun, usually fly fishing. That's awesome that you are able to stock your freezer. "
"I do all kinds of fishing. I have never done the sea fishing though."

"Ah, yes. I'm from Florida so that's all we have. Where are you from?"
"I live in TN, great fishing here"

"Oh! I've been there a time or two! Only to the big cities, though."
"yes I like it, simple life, slower pace."

column3:
"I've never been to Florida, but I hear that the weather is always nice."
"The weather is lovely! I love hot weather."

"Speaking of hot, I recently traveled to Texas. Between all the Spanish and the southern accent, I had a hard time keeping up."
"We do have thick accents, but our food is amazing."

"I heard good things about the fried conch in Florida. I'm not normally a seafood fan, but I am a deep fried food fan."
"I love seafood, but I've never had a fried conch."

"What about gator? I'm not a very adventurous eater; I don't know if I would be brave enough to try it myself."
"Negative. I'm a very picky eater. I like fish and shrimp."

"I know Florida is known for oranges, but I recently learned that it is also a big producer of strawberries. Are they better or cheaper there?"
"I personally think they are better, though not necessarily cheaper."

"Still . . . nice weather, great food . . . sounds like a great place for a visit."
"I'd say it is. They also have a lot of coastline there. More than any other state in the US."

'Really a lion?  That is some cool stuff.  '
'Reminds me of my dog. I accidentally shot him once.'

'What?  How did that happen?  '
'I was cleaning my rife and it went off. Poor guy was sleeping by the window.'

'I bet that scared him and you.  Do you like to shot for sport or for hunting?'
"I go hunting and take my dog. He loves it. I'm a bad shot, though."

'We hunt also.  Our family loves the outdoors.  He hunt, fish, and hike often.  Our goal is to climb Mt Everest.  '
"Me, too. I'm planning a trip there next year."

'That is excellent.  It will be several years before we are ready for a trip that big.'
"Yeah, it's a lot to take on. I have to get in shape and prepare mentally."

"Us too. WE have begun training, but I'm not sure we are going about it correctly.  What all are you doing to train?  "
'Cardio. Strength. Endurance. Crossword puzzles.'

"I'm only 18 and I still live at home."
"DO you live in an urban area or closer to nature?"

"The burbs. But there's woods behind the house."
"There is a lot of math found in nature. Are you familiar with the Fibonacci Sequence?"

"No. What's that?"
"The Fibonacci sequence is one of the most famous formulas in mathematics. Each number in the sequence is the sum of the two numbers that precede it."

"Isn't that like a spiral or something to do with shells?"
"Yes, the swirls, also known as the "Golden Ratio" found throughout nature."

"I heard about that in a science class, I think. Kind of over my head, though."
"I disliked math class myself but am intrigued how it applies to our natural world.  After all, math IS just a theory."

"Not really.  I find it hard to relate to people." 
"You are not a social type of person?"
"How so?"
"I am in a wheel chair, so they help me get around town."
"Oh yes, I'm sure they are very helpful right now.  Someday I will probably wish I got along with people better than animals."
"Yes they are sometime, but they are useful right now."
"It's just so hard to find a place to meet new people."
"Some people are pretty cool when you start knowing them."
"That's a good idea. I enjoy photographing animals, what are your hobbies?"
"Think of your favorite hobby, and find a group interested in the same hobby as you in your city. Thats the best way."
"I watch birds around my house and do some gardening."

column3:
Some mornings my cat is on the bed, a little bundle of heat next to me.
My cat is usually sleeping on top of me in the morning.  I am always trying to move him without waking him up.

I do that also, but then he decides he wants his breakfast, and then it's hard to ignore him.
Mine is the same and he asks loudly!

And then after he eats, he can spend the rest of the day sleeping.  But I have to stay up and go to work.
I am retired, and if I sit down for even a minute my cat is in my lap.  He can be a nuisance.

Maybe offices would be more fun if we had cats at our desks.
That I totally agree with, there is something soothing and comforting about hearing a cat purring.

I think retirement will be better than working in many respects, not just cat availability.
I love retirement.  How far from retirement are you?

Hopefully just a few years. I think about it a lot!
Well I think the secret to a happy retirement is to find something you like to do.  Sitting around can get very boring, stay busy.

column3:
He was in the military when I was in the 70s.
"It's so nice to talk to someone who knew my dad! So I guess you guys fought side by side in the war?"

We fought side by side and we ate side by side. Only red meat of course! We were good friends.
"Haha, well I'm a vegetarian so I guess I didn't get that from him. I love mushrooms and pasta, especially ravioli! What was his job in the military?"

Military police. He commanded the 110th division. Great man.
"Well, that's something we have in common! I have always had a desire to be a police officer."

Have you taken steps to acheive this dream?
"I was a junior police officer when I was a teenager and it was great! Since then I've been scared to take the leap!"

Thats too bad. You should always chase the dreams of your youth.
"Thanks for the encouragement!! Do you feel like you've accomplished your dreams? You're life seems fascinating!"

I beleive I have. I was kicked out of the military for beating up a general who misappropriated MRE rations.
"Wow, that's intense, were you starving?"

"I've heard of it.. I actually was held hostage once during a store robbery."
"Oh wow, I am glad you are okay. Nothing you can do to avoid it in public but I have a dog for home protection."

"I don't have a dog right now.. but we had one growing up.. my dad wasn't home much as he was a cop at the time."
"I am always home baking and cooking. I would worry about a family member having such a dangerous job."

"Well he's retired now.. so fortunately it worked out ok for him :)  I love to cook, but I'm not a very good baker :)"
"Aww good, I bet he enjoys retirement. That move Hostage showed how important a cops job is."

"Yeah it did.. it was actually fairly accurate, too.  Law Enforcement, in general, go through a LOT of turmoil in their lives."
"I have to most respect for them because they have to deal with extreme mental stress."

"Absolutely.. not a lot of jobs out there where you are literally unsure if you're going to be returning home alive at the end of the day."
"That would definitely be a job I would not want, but we need heroes to stop bad people like in Hostle."

"With the way the world is, yes, we always need Heroes :)"
"I would hate to imagine the world without people to protect us from the crazy's in the world today."

column3:
'That sounds like a great idea. Can you tell me more about Goodwill Industries?'
'Goodwill Industries help hire other who may lack education or face employment challenges. It helps them with work skills in that way.'

'Thats incredible! I am looking for a job at the moment. I recently finished up a six month contract as a broadway style dancer on a cruise ship.'
"How exciting! I've never been on a cruise. Where did you sail?"

'The cruise ship I worked on went to Jamacia, Mexico and the Cayman Islands. I would highly recommend cruising.'
"Maybe I'll look into some cruises in the Pacific. It's a good thing I live along the coast."

'You should. What do you do for work?'
'I freelance, but when I can, I do volunteer work with an organization that donates tools to families and communities in Africa.'

'Thats really neat! How did you get involved with the volunteer work?'
'I shop at Goodwill a lot and connected with a group that volunteers there.'

column3:

So true! Plus you're able to see the world from a perspective you've never seen. You ever been to Disney World?

Only once, many years ago.  I was just a child.
My mother took me a lot as a kid. My dad left when I was only 5, so she took me there to get my mind off of it.

It's good to be able to lose yourself in an activity you love.  For me now, that is painting.
Agreed. I wish I was talented enough to paint. Do you ever paint any rollercoaster portraits?

No, I never have.  I can visualize one peeking out over the trees from a distance though.  Joins nature and civilization in a whimsical way.
I bet your portraits are amazing! I get as much of a thrill out of nature as I do rollercoasters.

I wish I lived near the mountains...so much more variety in nature. But I have learned to find the beauty of the plains.

column3:
"She's a few months old. I am Mary from Colorado. What is your name?"
"Jeff, actually in the UK so a good distance from you. ;o) I would love a dog, I think it might make me exercise more"

"Awww wow you are a distance a way lol. Exercise is great I enjoy hiking in the summer. What do you prefer?"
"Well, I don't really know what I prefer yet as I'm just starting a health drive - after giving up smoking recently"

"Oh wow, that is amazing. Congratulations on your continued health journey. Quiting anything can be really hard."
"Thanks, I am rather proud as it was tough. What do you do in the winter though, if you hike in the summer only ?"

"You're very welcome. I like to go skiing in the mountains and relax at my cabin by a nice fire with a cup of hot cocoa."
"OOoooo that sounds idyllic. I wonder if I could persuade my friends to go with me to do that? I go on holidays with them, but have never tried skiiing."

"Yessss, persuade them to do so lol it is amazing. We only get one life so we might as well enjoy it, right?"
"Even if a leg or two gets broken - yes lol Can you take your puppy/dog with you to the lodge ?"

"Lol that is funny, yes I can take her and she enjoys it too. I buy the cute little coat and shoes for her to run around in the snow."
"Oh I've seen those dog snow boots, they are adorable. I'm back to wanting a dog.......lol"

'It is a composite of the many skills required for putting on a show.'

'Why yes as well as dancing too. Do you have a better car now?'
"That sounds fun! I used to do a bit of musical performance when I was younger. I have the same car actually but I don't drive as often now."

'Next week!'
'Good luck in your studying! what is the test on?'
"Oh, I drive a lot to put on my show and the hamburgers I eat keep me going. Are you living in a city then with mass transit?"
"I also love hamburgers, I probably eat far too much lol. Yeah I use buses and trams to get around now mainly."
"I live too far out of the city to use a bus. Isn't a hamburger a complete meal with tomato and lettuce?"
'Yeah, but you can add other ingredients too, my favourite is cheese and bacon. Do you like pizza? I just found a great place near me that does amazing pizzas.'

"I, too, like your mom "
"She's actually a really nice person, but I do wish I could live alone at times."
"I can only imagine. How old is your Mom? "
"She's young- only 55, but she has MS and needs someone to take care of her."
"That's horrible, my Mom is pushing 70 and went to Florida because that's where old people go."
"Is she still in good health?"
"for the most part, she used to smoke and she has bad teeth that will eventually need to come out "
"I'm sorry to hear that- dental work is so expensive in the US."
"What's it like to not almost die from eating apples?"
"I don't really like them much anyway. My mom does though, so I keep them in the house."

"I'm in medical school as well so I know how long the hours can be."
"What field of medicine are you studying?"

"Pediatrics. But I also love theater as well and I do community theater on the side."
"Ah cool! So you'll deal with children from birth through adolescence?"

"Basically. Anything to help kids and their diseases. I feel as if that's my 'calling'."
"Was there anything that made you want to become a pediatrician?"

"Well, I love kids and I was inspired by my own pediatrician as a kid. He was my role model growing up."
"That is really cool. how many years of school have you went through so far?"

"Only one thus far so I have a long road ahead of me to say the least. lol I'm at the University of Cincinnati."
"aaaah, but it will all be worth it in the long run!"

"So true! But if all else fails, I do enjoy theater work as well so theater is always an option. Ha!"
"Were you forced to go into medical school? It seems you really want to go into theater"

"Nah, I chose medical school as a career and theater is just sort of a hobby, ya know?"
"being a doctor will be more rewarding I think. Maybe you can still act as a hobby"

"Oh no that's no good grab a chair."

"Oh wow what kind of dog do you have? I'm actually looking for dog training jobs right now."

"How many kids do you have?"
"2- but that is a lot, trust me."
"I wouldn't know, I don't have any kids.  Do you have time for yourself with 2 kids?"
"Not really. I used to follow my favorite band's tour, but not anymore. :("
"That's too bad.  I would love to be a band's fashion coordinator.  It would be right up my alley."
'That sounds like fun! I always assumed bands just put on whatever clothes they felt like.'
"That's what they want you to think, but the biggest bands have their outfit coordination down to a science."
'Hmm ,never really thought about it that way. Why do you think that is?'
"I think it's just all about image and what they try to portray.  Are you influenced by the way band's look, or just their music?"
"Their look doesn't matter much to me- I'm all about the music!"
"Who's your favorite band?"
"Queens of the Stone Age- definitely!"

"It was strange, I could eat them, but I couldn't be anywhere near them while they were cooking.  do you have any quirks like that?"
"I haven't had any problems with foods, but pollen has always bothered."
'Had to go with hubby to work brunch, eggs cooking and I had to hide in bathroom. Have you ever had to stop because of pollen'
"I've never had to stop anything because of pollen, but allergy season is always tough."
"Do you have to take medicine for it" 
"I don't but I probably should. I just tough it out."
"Where do you work?"
'I work at a restaurant in the city. What about you?'
"Glad you don't have to work outside with allergies!  I tutor kids in math.  No cooking for me!"
"I've always been bad with math! How do you like tutoring?"
" love it, it's really rewarding. I am going to school to be an engineer, there just isn't a lot of time. I wish I could live forever!"
'Me too! More time in the day would be nice too.'

"Yeah, I mainly play to stay fit. I'm not overly competitive."
"I'm a bit worried about the physical tests to be honest, and need to increase fitness. Do you do any other sports?"

"Just keep practicing - I don't know too much about the physical tests, but I imagine they're interest. I also like swimming - easier on the joints."
"Ah theres a good idea, I have a pool locally. I could do something for charity.."

"Rabbits and deer mostly, I have a Bowie Knife to deal with them and we eat them."

"That's interesting. In my school district, 14-year-olds would be in high school. I do like the idea of having a broader mixture of ages, though."
"I remember school details here cause it was when I got my start playing football. I play now for the Philadelphia Eagles, my second season."

'Woah. Really? I grew up outside Philadelphia, in Cherry Hill, so you guys are still my home team!'
"Wow, small world! Yeah, last season I did not get a whole lot of playing time but now it's getting better."

"Have you been with the team long? Where did you play college ball?"
"I went to college at Wake Forest. I'm excited to finally be getting more playing time and starting my career!"

"So what's it like playing on a professional team? "
"It has its ups and downs like most things, but it's really rewarding to connect with fans and having them recognize you wherever you go."

"Do you think about what you'd like to do later in life, after you're done playing? Would you like to get into coaching or something else?"
"As of now I can't see myself coaching. Would love to save up, start a family, and just travel the world with them. See lots of countries while we're young."

"Yeah, that sounds cool. Get yourself a good financial advisor now, while you're young."
"You know, that would be a good idea. I feel I'm pretty frugal, but it's easy to get off track. I'll do that. Thank you for real."

"I don’t think i could eat something with legs everywhere!"

"Are you a vegetarian?"
"No i eat animals, but not ones that come out of the sea... four legs is ok but eight?"

"Haha! I totally understand. What's your favorite dish?"

"I can always go for a good pasta dish. I made some Thai basil zucchini noodles and they were delicious!"
"They sound delicious! Are you a vegetarian?"

"An omnivore! What other dishes have you experimented with?"

"I wish I could just get into her head and figure out exactly what she needs from me."
"take care and spend time with her . we could all be gone tomorrow ."

"No kidding. Forget my birthday, I might just set up a nice evening for her."

column3:
"it's been a while, last time i talked to them was in my college history class three years ago."
'Oh cool, I miss college :) were you a history major?'
'yes! i now teach at a middle school.'
"That's impressive! How long have you been teaching?"
'for over an year, really fun!'
"I bet it's really rewarding :) must take a lot of patience though"
'It does! but its worth it to teach youth about the past.'
'Absolutely, you have to know history to understand context of the present'
'"If not taught right the first time, history will only repeat itself"'
'Very true - and a good teacher can really make or break that experience'
'i agree, my teachers were always fun and made it a experience to never forget.'
"Lucky! I've had some really amazing teachers, and some where I learned a lot about how not to teach, haha"

column3:
Absolutely. I've heard horror stories from the larger ones. It's terrible what some people do.
It is sad. What made you decide to volunteer at nursing homes?

My dad recommended it after my grandma was in one. I just love being able to help, and cheering them up!
That is so sweet, you are such a good person. I am not volunteering anywhere right now, I'm to busy at my job as a cartographer for google maps.

Wow! How did you get that job? It sounds fun!
I kind of lucked into it at the beginning, I think it's a lot harder now. What do you do when you aren't volunteering?

I mostly just spend time with my family. My dad passed a few months ago.
I am so sorry to hear that. What is your favorite memory with him?

When I was little, we would go to a cut your own Christmas tree farm. It was the best!
That is such a nice memory. Are you doing ok right now?

Oh yes, we're getting through it all together. Thank you :)
Very good, I'm glad you have a good support network. My family all gets together and my brother starts hollering for us to all arm wrestle...so there's that LOL

column3:
Jesus. That's horrible. How are you coping?"
"I'm still kind of numb. It feels unreal."

Yeah. It will for a while. Plus everybody copes differently.  There's no "right" way to do it, no matter what people say."
"Well at least she's in a better place. I'm just going to miss her."

Do you have anyone close to you to lean on for support?"
"I really don't feel like reaching out. I just want to curl up with some ice cream and be alone for a while."

You know what, that's totally ok. You have to look after yourself."
"Do you have a favorite movie to watch when you're sad?"

I think it really depends on the situation--sometimes I want something that will help me cry it out while other times something that will cheer me up is better."
"My go-to was Thomas the Train, but that's definitely out the window now."

oh man...I'm sorry.  I like to go surfing to take my mind off of things but maybe that's not for you."

'Oh no! Do you burn foods often?'
"No, hardly ever! I'm a great cook but not the best at baking. Maybe I should just stick to writing. Aspiring journalist here"
'Very lucrative career. What do you write about?'
'Generally politics. I am fascinated by what motivates politicians to do the outlandish things they do.'
"I'm more of a fan of the past than the present. I like the Victorian era."
"My mom is a librarian, I grew up in a home that was more focused on fiction and the past. I'm more interested in here and now"
'My mom owned a doll store. I collect them now. My favorite is a doll that looks like Queen Victoria.'
"I could understand your love for history in that case. That's more interesting than some of the boring things she would read to us kids haha"
'What books would she read to you?'
'Usually obscure things that were above my comprehension level for my age'
"I have a low comprehension level, I'm sure I wouldn't understand those today"

"Wow, that sounds awesome! How hard was it to learn?"

column3:
That would be cool! My best friend from tanzania some times sends me the stamps they have over there.
That is so amazing! My best friend is visiting me from Tanzania next week!

That's so cool! what are you guys gonna do?
He is just as passionate about collecting stamps as I am so we are going to go to a few auctions and seee if there are any good deals

Always good to have a hobby you can do together! My friend and I are always cracking jokes to each other!
Yes it is. For whatever reason when we get together, almost like a ritual, we watch our favorite movie - Dirty Harry. Have you ever seen it?

Love that movie! but comedy is more of my genre! laughter is the best medicine!
I completely agree! You have to laugh in life for health and happiness. Comedy movies are a great source of joy in my life, second to stamp collecting ;)

If i can have a good laugh, i will always be happy! and haha! it's a great hobby!
It's the perfect hobby because there is always a never ending stream of new stamps. What is your favorite hobby?

Very true! And going to the movies!
What is your favorite movie?
column4:

一起做爱好总是很好！我和我的朋友总是互相开玩笑！

如果我能开心大笑，我就会一直很快乐！哈哈！这是一个很棒的爱好！

他和我一样热衷于集邮，所以我们打算去几场拍卖会看看是否有什么好的交易。

column3:
my puppy was 18 years old.  i don't think there is another that can take her place. she was beautiful.
Oh goodness, that has to be hard. 18 is a long life for a dog, but it never feels like it's long enough

i know. my son was hinting at finding me a new pup ... but i am not feelin' that.  the attachment and all.

column3:
"I'm actually not legally married to my husband (though I call him that). We are common-law partners.  Doesn't bother me but I'm sure it would bug some people."
"I haven't managed to find anyone yet, but I think as long as your in love, your legal status doesn't matter"

Agreed.  For us, marriage just seemed like a waste of money--you can do a lot more exciting things with that amount!'
"Yes, you can! What do you guys like to do together?"

"We play video games, watch movies. He's a lot more athletic than I am, but I try to join him on hikes when I can."
"That sounds like a good way to have fun and get some exercise! I'm rather lazy myself, I just like to sleep in. "

"Oh, me too!  I'm a night owl and I hate getting up early in the morning."
"Mornings are the worse! I've been trying to find a night job so I can sleep all day."

"I did that through a lot of university!  What do you like to do for fun?"
"Mostly watching tv. I haven't found any good shows lately. "

"What are some of your favorites?  My top two are definitely The Wire and Deadwood."
"I really enjoyed Stranger Things and Sabrina. I tried watching This Is Us recently but couldn't get into it."
column4:

我们玩电子游戏，看电影。他比我更有运动天赋，但我尽量在能够的时候和他一起去远足。

我还没有找到任何人，但我认为只要你们相爱，你们的法律地位就不重要。

"可以的！你们喜欢一起做什么？"

这听起来是一个很好的方式来玩耍和锻炼身体！我自己比较懒，我只是喜欢睡懒觉。

column3:
"I get to spend the weekend with my daughter, she loves shopping so I'm gonna spoil her silly!"
"That sounds like a great way to spend the weekend. I spent last weekend shopping."

"Yeah? What kind of stuff did you buy?"
"I didn't buy much but did find some new clothes to wear to work. Are you looking to buy anything in particular this weekend?"

"That's good, as my wife says, you can never have enough clothes! But nothing too expensive hopefully, have to save for Christmas."
"I can't believe Christmas is almost here. I don't start to think about it until after Thanksgiving."

"I think about it all year round I really like Christmas time, especially when it snows."
"It doesn't snow around where I live so it's hard to get in the Christmas mood with warmer weather"

"Well on the up side at least you don't have to shovel any of it when you can barely feel you're hands because of the cold!"
"Yes, it definitely has it's benefits!"

"Indeed. But do you have any special plans for Christmas time?"
"Nothing planned yet. It's hard for me to travel because I can't walk"

column3:
I do live in a big city, tons of people. However, I never feel closed in- I feel like the opportunists are boundless. Especially after graduating college.
oh, wow! congratulations! what was your major?

My major was American literature and education. Aiming to make it big in the the big city. Where are you from?
nashville, tennessee! the great music city!  the population has boomed. it's like a little new york city.

That is a great city! I used to live up north in Kentucky. Always loved to visit the beautiful city of Nashville!
kentucky is beautiful country. lots of land.  do you miss kentucky?

Everyday, thats where my family lives. Is Nashville where you were born?
no. i was born in birmingham. i don't miss it, though.

Oh ok, also visited birmingham... Would much rather be in Nashville as well ;)
right! nashville is awesome. lots of opportunity.

Very cool. Lost of opportunity everywhere though if we seek it. What takes you to Nashville?
education and opportunity. it never failed me.  it was good chatting with you. much luck to you! have a good one!

column3:
"I'm sorry to hear that, I can't imagine not having pets"
"yeah i would love to get a little yorkie"

"Yorkies are great, I'm more of a cat person myself though"
"I prefer dogs but I still like cats. how many do you have?"

"I only have one, it's a good companion but independent enough to take care of itself while I'm at work"
"cats are probably better for people who work away from home. i was watching someone's dog once and they refused to eat until their owner returned"

"That sounds stressful. I work long hours at a doctor's office so I can't have pets that require too much attention, unfortunately"
"Oh, I am sorry to hear that, it seems like it would be an exhausting job, so that is understandable"

"It is, but it's very rewarding! I do spend a lot of time outside of work reviewing patient files, but it's not too bad."
"Lucky it's a rewarding job. There are so many jobs out there that the world would be better off without"

"That is definitely true. What do you do?"
"Random gigs here and there. But mostly trying to get a communal garden going"

是的，历史往往会在某种程度上重复。人类社会存在着一些固定的模式和趋势，导致某些事件在不同的时代和环境下重复出现。这也是为什么历史学家经常会引用“历史的周期性”这一概念。但同时，

他们是我们社会的未来，他们将成为下一代的领导者、创新者和改变者。因此，我们应该尽一切努力确保他们受到良好的教育、关爱和支持，以便他们能够充分发挥他们的潜力，为社会的发展和进

不要灰心，困难只是暂时的。只要我们坚持努力，相信自己，一定能够克服困难，走出困境。加油！我们一起努力，一起战胜困难！

"They're a good way to escape from reality! Do you have a favorite?"
"Its so hard to pick a favorite. A good one I recently got into is called The Outer Worlds. It's similar to older Fallout games."
"I don't play them much myself, but I like to watch YouTubers play the games."
"Ah, I do that whenever I cant afford to buy a game. I just love the immersive storytelling the games can provide"
"I like watching the gameplays so I can watch it like a movie. My favorite is The Last of Us."
"The Last of Us is TOTALLY like a movie! The emotion that the characters convey is so well done."
"Right! I love what Ellen Page did with the character."
"The actors did a fantastic job. I really want to play the sequel eventually."
"I need to watch the story again. It's been so long, it would be like new."
"If I could forget the game and go in blind again, I would"

column3:
I hardly work out. I mainly lost the weight by eating healthier and working hard at my job. I detail cars.
That will really help you to maintain your overall health.

A keto diet is what I am on. It's low carb, high fat, medium protein. High fat sounds bad, but the diet is actually one of the best.
I've heard that this diet is very effective in helping to lose weight.  You've proved it.

Its incredibly healthy. Although, the start of the diet is a little bumpy because you have to go through whats called a 'Keto Flu'.
That doesn't sound nice! Have you recovered from the Keto Flu yet?

Oh yeah, it lasts about a week or less. I've been on the diet for months now.
I admire your discipline.  Although, try not to overdo it with the weight loss.

The weight loss doesnt go too far on the diet anyway. Just gets rid of the weight you really dont need
There's nothing I love more than a doughnut after I've been in the studio.  Not sure I could keep it up for months like you!

The diet allows for a lot of variety. Bacon is actually a staple part of the diet if you are into that!
Yes, I'm definitely into bacon.  What food do you like?

"Ive never had a job in another country. Surely its nerve racking?"
"Thanks! It's in Germany so I have to move. Luckily I already speak the language."

"Relax and be yourself! I wonder what the weather is like there"
"I'm a little nervous but I'm sure I'll be fine."

"Is it usually cloudy in Germany? That's what I have always heard."
"People are always asking me that... "How's the weather up there?" *sigh*..."

"Im from the USA. The summers here are always sunny and hot. I wonder how summers are there... Summer's my favorite."
"I'm not really sure, I guess I'll find out when I get there! Where are you from?"

"I used to like sports, but I dont play them anymore. I dont have the physical coordination for it"
"Do you like any sports? I play basketball."

"Might sound weird, but I like listening to classic radio programs. The old stuff fascinates me"
"Sorry to hear that. What else do you like to do?"

"Hard rock! Can't live a day without it"
"Asking alexandria, hellyeah, motionless in white, five finger death punch, highly suspect (can't wait for their new album), in this moment, halestorm. you?"
"That's so funny! What kind of dog do you have? Mine only enjoys older stuff if it's 30 seconds to mars. Chihuahuas love Jared Leto"

"It should be. What do you do? "

"Me either. What are you listening to these days?"
"I've been revisiting Every Time I Die's early discography lately. My dog is wildly unhappy about it."

I would like to go to school to become a veterinarian and help animals.
you should follow your dreams. I achieved mine and I feel you can too.

What were the dreams have you achieved. I had dreams of getting three pets and I did. 3 dogs I have.
I have a lakeside house where I currently walk around the property and read my books. what type of dogs do you have?

Oh beautiful. I love houses that sit on a body of water. I have a Chihuahua and two golden retrievers.
yes it is quite. You should see it sometime. Oh I love retrievers, they remind me of my old dog.

They are very good and loyal dogs. Yes a quiet place to live is key.
when did you get them all? I agree, me and my wife are very happy.

3 years ago. I bought them all in the same day. They were puppies and now best friends.
that's what I call a puppy brigade!

yes. They are adorable and the small one actually thinks he is the leader/
They always do. I'm glad you're enjoying your dogs. I must be getting back to my reading now.

I do, especially on my motorcycle. The wind in my hair on the open road - nothing compares.

I don't own a motorcycle but I know that sensation. It's the best!
Oh yeah. Would you ever consider buying one?

I prefer cars because I can also drive my husband and kids!
Good point. Would be difficult to fit them all on a bike!

Exactly! We take lots of road trips! It's a lot of fun!
I bet. What's the best trip you've taken, or place you've been to?

Oh... I'd say the best trip was the one to Colorado. Have you been there?
Many years ago. We visited Pike's Peak, but I didn't really appreciate it at the time. I'd like to go back some day.

'My children are mostly grown. I like gardening and grow vegetables that I cook.' 
'Wow! Many people find gardening very relaxing. What about you with all the different things?'

'I find it very relaxing. I love watching what I plant grow.'
"Do you live in a suburban area or in an urban area with less space to cultivate?  It's amazing how much you can grow in a small space."

'I live in a suburban area but have a nice back yard.'
'Wow! I want to come visit your garden! Ha! Do you grow the plants directly in your yard or do grow the plants in large containers?'

'A mix of both. I usually do half and half. Although certain veggies grow better in pots'
'Well, i live in the midwest and it gets really cold out here. Do you recommend any plants that can grow in harsh weather?'

"I can't think of plants for cold weather. I live in south florida."
'Must be nice to be able to plant year round. I guess out here we plant when we can lol.'

'True. Anything that can grow in cold conditions has to be rugged and durable.'
'I guess its different if you live where it gets cold during the winter. I guess i have until spring to think of what we will be planting lol.'

"I'm an art lover too, I have a house full of it!"
"Oh how wonderful! Who are your favorite artists?"
"I really like Albrecht Durer"
"Oh a German renaissance painter! I like abstract works, personally."
"I enjoy abstract art as well, but I really like etchings"
"Very unique! Have you ever heard of the Lascaux caves? I know they're not etchings but they're said to be spectacular!"
"No, I haven't! Where is that?"
"They're beautiful cave engravings in southwestern France. They're said to have been originally created 17,000 years ago!"
"Wow, that sounds amazing. I'll have to check that out when I'm in France. Do you like to travel?"
"I do love to travel! I've seen many places in the world but always want to see more! Do you travel a lot?"
"Not as much as I'd like to, but I try"
"That's interesting. I can imagine having the restrictions lifted helped artists and collectors share their work. I love huge paintings!"

column3:
"I'm not entirely sure." "I'm not the least bit surprised, since she was considered a bit of an eccentric by her neighbors."
"Anyone who is a hermit or recluse would be considered eccentric. A lot of creative people are as well" "That's true. Anyone who marches to the beat of their own drum is often shunned."
"When they should be welcomed and celebrated. Just because someone else's version of happy doesn't match our own doesn't make theirs wrong" "That's totally right! In hindsight I'm sure people would have gotten to know her"
"I'm not so sure. Some things have progressed while others have not in my opinion" "That is fair, I should have specified. Some people would have retrospectively been able to appreciate her work, had they known. She still wouldn't have appealed to everyone."
'Hindsight is always 20/20' 'Indeed. Oh well at least we can appreciate her work now!'
'Agreed' 'I wonder who her influences were'

column3:
'It was especially exciting because it was his first time!'
'Impressive! You must have started teaching him quite early?'
"He's always just been a natural. We never put him in anything competitive because we wanted him to continue enjoying swimming"
'That was a smart move. Adding to much pressure can make children resent activities'
'Adult life is filled with pressure. Kids should enjoy just being kids'
'I definitely agree! Being able to be a part of their lives during that stage is so great'
'Do you have children?' 'Not always haha'
'No, but someday hopefully I will have some. Do you enjoy being a parent?'
'I enjoy reading after everyone goes to bed and the house is quiet'
'I can understand that. What other hobbies do you have?'
'I also enjoy reading, specifically animal related books.'

"my Ex-Husband LOOOOOOOOOOOVED it so much, that he gave them to his sisters and our oldest son tommy. and none of them got sick, Darling! :D"

"It;s his loss don't let him stop you're prowl you understand me !!!!"

"Sammy is a keeper he can cook and I would hope he has long hair also which comes with attractiveness. lol"
"he's about 72 Darling and has gone bald Darling. while i'm 68 and have BEAUTIFUL hair. we try out hair and cream in our muffens. want to try them? "

column3:
I am from the south, Alabama, how about you?
I read a lot. Alabama seems to come up in several of Stephen King's books.

I also read alot, love learning new things. What else do you like reading?
I read the Bible more often than anything else. My son is an author so of course I read his books.

Oh really? Does he write fiction or nonfiction?
mostly fiction. I help edit his books.

You guys must have a good relationship. I have made some money on side by editting various mediums.
He does not pay me for editing, but I get sneak peaks and several FREE books. We do have a great relationship.

Free books is a great perk. Is he your only child?
No, I have 3. Sadly for me the oldest is in eternity.

I'm sorry to hear that! I don't have any kids yet, hoping someday I will though
There is no greater joy than children. Enjoy someone else's until you are blessed with your own.

column3:
"He beat up his sister! I never know how to handle these situations. I don't want to use violence against violence"
"Have you considered sending him to timeout? That would be a way to punish him without being violent with him"

"He's a bit too old for timeout. Grounding him doesn't really seem to work either"
"How old is he?"

"He's 14 and his sister is 12. They've really been jerks to each other lately"
"I'm sorry you're having such a hard time with them. Beating up a sibling is a serious issue. You should find a way to punish him somehow."

"Do you have kids? I'm just not used to this kind of conflict. I was never like this with my sister growing up so I'm not sure what to do"
"I don't have kids. I've only got two cats. They fight, but I'm not sure that dealing with conflict among pets qualifies me to offer parenting advice."

"Maybe I should get a spray bottle and squirt them when they fight haha"
"It works for my cats!"

And most highschool language teachers are utter garbage. The pace isn't fast enough and there's not enough immersion.
True, although I don't know about it not being fast enough. I think in my case it was too fast. Going from 'hola' to complex sentences in like two days

Yeah, there's a balance to be sure. They also have you learn dumb things, like "where is the library" instead of basic conversation, like "I'm hungry"
True. Not sure who exactly would be looking for a library in another language. Maybe if it's like a famous landmark in Spain or something, but otherwise it's useless

There are a lot of great tools for learning languages now. Apps and such
For sure. I don't know that I'll ever get around to actually ever using one. Might need some incentive, like a spouse who speaks it

What language would you like to learn?
Probably Spanish would be the most useful since it's the second most common here. Otherwise, French would be cool because it's more rare and romantic. Hah

I'd like to learn Italian, that's my ancestry, even though I have long blonde hair, lol
Oh, Italian is good, too. Kinda similar to Spanish though, so if you had hard time with that, Italian won't be much easier probably.

"that sounds like a lot of work."

"my brothers and sisters help me with the horses. we worked about 5pm to 10:30pm and eat dinner about 4pm."

column3:
I am headed to the beach for a nice little mini-vacation.
Sounds really nice, for me maybe I'll paint something
I'm headed to Jersey. I'm a Salvatorre from that area if you know anything about the family.
No not really. Can you fill me in please?
Well, it's a joke to be honest. My real last name is spanish, Salvador. But I'm a big Mafia buff and the Salvatorre's are a famous Mafia name.
Cool! I'm and avid artist and a bit of a scientist. Did you know that Salvador means Saviour in Portuguese?
That's quite interesting. I joke that I'm Italian but I'm just a big goof.
How come? Why do you say that?
Well, my mom was brilliant but I ended up with the brains from my father whom I never knew. Apparently he wasn't too bright.
It doesn't mean you are goof. You are the only one who put your own limitations not others.
Well thank you so much for that vote of confidence. So what types of paintings do you create?
All of them. Cubism, realistic, dark truth... Whatever comes to the mind.

"Oh wow, that's a cool job. Do you ever get cramped up from driving? I heard some places use electric trucks now."

"One time it took 3 months for my left hand to turn loose of the steering wheel. Had to remove it so I could pee."
"wow , that is crazy ! that never happened to me before !"

"I gave up driving after that and marrying my sweetheart. We put a bow tie on the steering wheel at the wedding."
"i am genuinely happy for you."

"Thank you kindly. How about you, you married?"
"no. I hope to though, someday"

"It will sneak up on you when you least expect it. Just keep your eyes on the road."
"i will keep that in mind . thanks for the great advice"

column3:
"I wasn't and I kinda happy I didn't." 
"Why do you feel that way?"

"Well, my cousin's life has been messed up since she had the baby and my mother, she's a retired teacher, has been trying to help her."
"Do you think that you will try to get pregnant again?"

"Yes, now that I'm married and older, I do want to have a child."
"That's good. Its always nice to have a support system behind you"

"Yes, but right now we have a good life together, so we may wait a bit. Are you married?"
"I have been married for about 5 years now."

"Oh congrats, still kinda newlyweds, eh? lol."
"High school sweethearts so I feel like we have been together forever."

"Oh, how wonderful. That's always so good. I have two high school friends who married and are so happy."
"Yes, by growing up together it really gives you a chance to get close."

"My older brother plays in the NFL. I worry every time he's out there, but I know he's doing what he loves."
"He is a professional I'm sure he will be alright."

"All the head trauma controversy is making me nervous; sometimes you don't know you were effected until much later in life."
"You see this happen with hockey, players being affected well into the retirement."

"I like to watch hockey, but I am not very knowledgeable about the sport in general."
"I like the action, although I have been distracted lately, I keep thinking about the lovely Rita Hayworth"

"She definitely is an icon, but that's a pretty random choice. Did you watch one of her movies recently?"
"I was black and white older movies and she caught my eye."

"She was a beautiful dancer as well as a great actress."
"I would love to dance with her in the rain. It sounds romantic. What do you think? Am I crazy?"

"There are many people I'd love to dance in the rain with, if I could go back in time."
"That would be awesome, there is an allure."

"I don't know? I guess school and stress just gets to people sometimes."
"Yeah it can be more than a normal temporary reaction to life events. Although I try to keep perspective like a lot of people struggle with this and worse problems."

"I know. Just hard to believe that my roommate would be rummaging through my things. I wonder if she has been stealing from me?"
"its totally possible. Did you get to find out why she did that?"

"I haven't spoken with her about it yet. I just caught her on video going through my desk. How do you bring something like that up?"
"definitely possible"

"I don't like confrontation, and this is not a discussion I am looking forward to having. But I have to stand up for myself."
"have you tried confronting her?"

"I tried to bring it up yesterday but she was in a hurry to get out the door."
"i'd suggest you find a time you're sure she's not going out and talk about it"

"I know. I just need to set a time and sit down and do it. Hope for the best. Maybe there is a reason?"
"yeah. i like to give a person benefit of the doubt. Maybe there's a reason,like you said."

column3:
"My brother went through a time where he'd hop in the back of my car and scare me."
"Oh jeez haha, that's so terrifying!"

"It was terrible. But now Im desensitized. How often does you husband scare you?  "
"Not too often, so it really keeps me on my toes!"

"Thats the worst because your never expecting it. "
"Exactly! Does your boyfriend like to scare you often>"

"3 brothers growing up, I do the scarring mostly.  :)"
"Oh man! I grew up as an only child, what was it like having all those brothers bothering you?"

"Almost as bad as my 3 sisters. If I could make a gross face I would."
"Haha that's a lot of siblings! I bet that was fun on holidays"

"Sometimes it was. I get along better with my brothers. Always have!  "
"Cool, siblings can be like really good friends if they get along. Most of my friends growing up were friends with theirs"

column3:
Yeah Iced tea is good. I like young love as well.  I have been married to my high school sweet heart for 15 years.  
I married my husband 10 years ago in December. Thats amazing 15 years! Oh wow how old were you when you met your partner?
We met when I was 20 he was 33. How about you? We met when were were 16.  We have been together for 15 years.  
Wow. Thats amazing. Are you happy? Yes, our relationships can be complicated but overall it is very good.
Most people are not honest about marriage. Its very refreshing to hear.   Yep. I think people today don't take marriage as serious as it should be taken.
I agree. I understand when 2 people have given it their all and it doesn't work, but thats not usually the case. I totally agree for you. Marriage isn't easy.  Takes hard work.

婚姻是一种承诺和责任，需要双方都付出努力来维持和经营。然而，现代社会的快节奏生活和变化使得人们更容易忽视婚姻中的重要性，导致许多人对婚姻并不诚实或认真对待。

许

"I understand that, what's why I got tattoos, they bring me back to center"
"Many people think tattoos are for criminals but that's not the case. They can reflect how you are feeling and are art!"

"Exactly, I'm glad someone else understands!"
"It is a good way to put your emotions into your artwork"

"I agree! I feel like recycling is also a great trait!"
"I agree too! And you can to some great art while recycling. Art has really helped me as I am struggling with my marriage."

"Yes, art is the best. There's nothing quite like it!"
"That is true. It allows you to express yourself whether you are sad or happy."

"Exactly! Tattoos are the ultimate expression of self"
"Agreed. I have one symbolic with a specific meaning pertinent to me."

"Oh what is it of?"
"It is a heart with a large red rose in the center! My husband designed it for me so it is special to me."

"I'm in tech, so I work with a lot of people from China. It's an interesting culture, from what I can tell."
'To be honest, i have never visited it yet. But I am very eager to go there'

"Cool. Do you speak the language yourself? Do you have contact with family that still live there?"
'no . do you speak other languages ?'

"Me? Yeah. Spanish, Italian, French, Ladino. Had Greek and latin in school, but don't remember much."
"That's interesting. A lot of cool things to learn for sure."

"I love to travel. I'd love to travel to another planet and meet aliens!"
"i would love to travel some day . i've never really been anywhere"

"I think everyone should travel if they can."
"Yes definitely! Who doesn't? Although sometimes relatively short stays between places are not as fun."

"Right?!  It's a rich history"
"sure is! and there is a lot of history too begining in 1607...."

"I had no idea it went back that far.  Where did you find that information?"
"I done searches online, went to the library, and even visited some universities to see what information they found"

"Wow, you're quite the historian. I do love doing that kind of research, though"
"I enjoy learning about new and different things so that is a plus. Research is great, it's like putting together a puzzle."

"I actually work in research for a living.  I think my dad gave me that love."
"Your dad is a smart man, that is awesome!"

"It's a fascinating job.  I review research done in humans (you know, clinical trials) for ethics"
"That is amazing...I love that field. so many exciting new things every day."

"True, every day is completely different"
"You come in contact with so many different type of people...i think that sounds like a cool job"

素食者是指不食用任何动物来源的食物，包括肉类、禽类、鱼类、奶制品和蛋类等，只食用植物来源的食物。素食者通常选择这种饮食方式是出于对动物权益、环境保护或健康等方面

'I like pecan, but I usually only have it around Thanksgiving.'

'Same here, and Christmas time as well.'
'The time between Thanksgiving and Christmas is my favorite part of the year.'

'I love spring time the best, when everything is coming back to life.'
'Spring is nice, but every seems so busy then. In the winter, my family slows down and spends more time together.'

'Fun, exciting times are nice once in a while, but I would choose peaceful and quiet for the long-term.'

"I am not familiar with greenfly - is that a type of insect?"
"yeah that's right, they swarm over the tree and 'suffocate' it meaning it doesn't produce any apples."

"I see. Are they easy to get rid of, or is it a yearly battle?"
"Apparently if you cover the tree with fairy liquid it's supposed to help but it definitely didn't work for us! Do you have any other fruit trees?"

"That's too bad. Yes, I have a couple of pear trees and cherry trees. Those at least produce some fruit for us."
"Oh that's great. I love fruit so we have 10 different trees in our garden!"

"10 different trees!? What kinds?"
"Cherry, pears, apples, and oranges!"

"An orange tree sounds fun. I live in too cold of an area to grow one"
"Yeah only possible in warmer climates unfortunately!"

财务管理是每个人都应该重视的重要事项。一个有效的财务计划可以帮助您更好地管理您的资金，并确保您的财务状况保持稳定。其中一个关键的方面是制定预算并且坚持预算。

制定一个预算意味着明确规划您的收入

我会每个月制定预算，记录每一笔开支和收入，以便掌握自己的财务状况。我会仔细分析我的消费习惯，看看哪些地方可以节省，哪些地方可以削减开支。我也会尽量避免 impulse buying，避免不必要

"Sorry to hear. I think you need a little time off. Stress is a killer."

"Yeah, the money is nice but it's not worth sacrificing my mental health."
"I totally understand. You must take good care of yourself and your mental health. Maybe take a nice long relaxing bath tonight?"

"That sounds nice, maybe I'll call in sick tomorrow too."
"Lol, yes! A "mental health day" is in order!"

"My perfect mental health day would probably be staying in bed, hanging out with the dogs, having food delivered, and reading a good book."
"That sounds like a really great day! I think I'll do exactly the same thing tomorrow. But I will also play some music."

"Yes, of course! Music makes every day better."
"It sure does! I'm working on some really great new songs on my piano!"

"I like piano music. I can't play, but I like it. How long have you been listening to piano? Do you play?"
"since I can remember. I enjoy it a lot."
"Do you have a favorite pianist?"
"I like Jakob Ludwig. He was a German composer and pianist born in the early 1800s."
"Interesting. I don't know much about famous pianists, or about playing. Is it hard to learn?"
"It takes lots of practice at first. Do you play any instruments?"
"I can play a little guitar, and I play the drums a little too."
"Wow, I would love to hear you play sometime."
"I'm not very good, but I continue to practice."
"I don't get out much to see concerts though."
"Me either, I try to see at least one concert a year."
"I'm so busy with school that I don't have the time or the money for concerts."

"Oh, that's right! I like fishing, but I usually just slap a worm on a hook."
"Same here. I generally take my dog "socks" with me when I go fishing. He loves the water."

"I usually just bring my cooler full of beer. How did Socks get his name?"
"Not sure. I "adopted" from someone else and he was already named. Do you have pets?"

"Nope, no time for pets. Too busy fishing."
"Ok, that's cool. What do you drive? I get to drive around in a silver lexus."

"I drive a ford pick-up. It is good for driving around on the backroads. I take it to the creek sometimes, so I wanted something I could get muddy."
"That makes sense. I would feel pretty powerful in something that big."

"What else do you like to do for fun?"
"I like the outdoors so hiking is another favorite activity of mine."

"Oh, that's cool. Do you usually take your dog?"
"Yes, he keeps the bad guys away. LOL"

'I like to cook because I can save some money and still have a good meal.'
"I just don't know how to prepare them I guess."

'Do you just eat burgers or do you have anything with them'
'I suppose but I never learned to cook and I would just rather eat a burger.'

'Why not, they make any dish so much better'
'I just buy frozen burger patties and throw them on the george forman. Just like my dad before he got locked up.'

'You can always find fun ways to cook them on the internet'
"Usually a salad from a bag but I don't care for it."

'I think if you branched out a bit you would find something you enjoy'
'Maybe, but who has that kind of time'

'True, but it would be time well spent'
'I suppose so.'
